intro: Onosma edmondsonii, commonly known as the Edmondson's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, pale blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing its adaptation to harsh, dry conditions. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds. Onosma edmondsonii is often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of these ecosystems.
